model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Co-workers B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: I feel so grateful to have a boss who is always so supportive of me.
Co-workers B: That's amazing to hear. Having a supportive boss can make all the difference in how you feel about your job.
Co-workers A: Definitely. It makes me feel secure in my position and motivated to do my best work.
Co-workers B: It's great to have that kind of positive reinforcement. Do you remember when we were working on that movie together and you were feeling really frustrated?
Co-workers A: Oh yeah, I remember. I was so angry after blowing up that rabbit with the dynamite. But talking it out with you really helped me work through my emotions.
Co-workers B: That's right. It's important to have someone to talk to when you're feeling overwhelmed or upset.
Co-workers A: And speaking of talking it out, do you remember when I was a kid and I ran to our parents screaming because of that spider?
Co-workers B: Ha, yes I do! It's funny to think about now, but phobias are no laughing matter.
Co-workers A: Absolutely. And on a lighter note, I made a pair of wire earrings the other day. It was so much fun to create something beautiful with my own hands.

[MEMORY]
Co-worker B emphasized the importance of learning from mistakes and working together as a team, causing Co-worker B to acknowledge that some people have fears and suggests finding healthy ways to deal with frustrations. This led Co-worker A to overcome fears and anxieties to create beautiful earrings. 
Co-worker B expressed disapproval of Co-worker A's actions and suggested talking to the director to address the stressful situation, which caused Co-worker B to encourage Co-worker A to try relaxation techniques or find a hobby to de-stress and overcome fears, ultimately leading Co-worker A to create beautiful earrings. 
Co-worker B expressed disapproval of Co-worker A's actions and suggested talking to the director to address the stressful situation, which caused Co-worker B to encourage Co-worker A to try relaxation techniques or find a hobby to de-stress and overcome fears. This, in turn, led to Co-worker A growing as a person and as an artist, learning about empathy and compassion.

These memories highlight their communication process and how Co-worker B provides solutions to handle stressful situations, and indirect encouragement leading to Co-worker A's personal growth and creativity.
